qas.question: When did CRA make rule changes to relax underwriting standards?
How much were CRA loan commitments between 1994 and 2007?
What was the Federal Reserve's assumption regarding what makes a loan subprime?

answers.text: high-interest-rate loans (3 percentage points over average)

qas.question: How did the Federal Reserve classify CRA loans?
When were ultra-low interest rates initiated by the Federal Reserve?

answers.text: after the terrorist attack on September 11, 2001

context: To other analysts the delay between CRA rule changes (in 1995) and the explosion of subprime lending is not surprising, and does not exonerate the CRA. They contend that there were two, connected causes to the crisis: the relaxation of underwriting standards in <a0_0>1995<a0_0/> and the ultra-low interest rates initiated by the Federal Reserve <a4_0>after the terrorist attack on September 11, 2001<a4_0/>. Both causes had to be in place before the crisis could take place. Critics also point out that publicly announced CRA loan commitments were massive, totaling <a1_0>$4.5 trillion<a1_0/> in the years between 1994 and 2007. They also argue that the Federal Reserve’s classification of CRA loans as “<a3_0>prime<a3_0/>” is based on the faulty and self-serving assumption that <a2_0>high-interest-rate loans (3 percentage points over average)<a2_0/> equal “subprime” loans.
